name: HANS CHRISTIAN 34
notes:
Though relatively few were built, it is the precursor to another series of boats built in far greater numbers. It is said that before the first (34 foot) boat hit the water, a second set of molds were created  for a 'stretched' version, first called the HANS CHRISTIAN 36, and later built as the UNION 36 among other names. Though the 36 foot version is still often considered a Robert Perry design, it was never authorized by him, nor were royalties ever paid.
Thanks to 34 owner Bill Lockwood (and others) for providing updated information.
